parts.text: {"word":"outsold","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(商品などが)(～より)多く売れた、売り上げで上回った","english_definition":"to sell more than (another product or company).","examples":[{"sentence":"The new model outsold the previous one.","translation":"新型モデルは旧型モデルより多く売れた。"},{"sentence":"Their debut album outsold all other albums that year.","translation":"彼らのデビューアルバムは、その年、他のすべてのアルバムより多く売れた。"},{"sentence":"This product has outsold all expectations.","translation":"この製品は予想をはるかに上回る売り上げを記録した。"}],"collocations":["outsold expectations (予想を上回る売り上げ)","outsold the competition (競合製品より多く売れた)","outsold all other products (他のすべての製品より多く売れた)"],"synonyms":["exceeded sales","surpassed in sales","bettered in sales","outstripped in sales"],"antonyms":["undersold"],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Outsold' is the past tense and past participle of the verb 'outsell'. It means that one product or company has sold more units or generated more revenue than another. It is commonly used in business and marketing contexts to compare the performance of different products or companies.","priority":"★★★"}],"etymology":{"value":"Formed by combining the prefix 'out-' (meaning 'more than' or 'exceeding') with the verb 'sold', the past tense and past participle of 'sell'.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˌaʊtˈsoʊld/","syllables":"out-sold"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["outsells"],"past_simple":"outsold","past_participle":"outsold","present_participle":"outselling"}},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The book outsell than the movie.","correct":"✓ The book outsold the movie.","note":"The correct construction is 'outsold' + the object being surpassed in sales. The word 'than' is not needed."},{"incorrect":"✗ The company is outsold by its competitor.","correct":"✓ The company was outsold by its competitor.","note":"When using the passive voice, the correct form is 'was outsold' (past simple passive) or 'has been outsold' (present perfect passive), depending on the context. 'Is outsold' implies a continuous state, which is less common."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["outsell (verb - present tense)","outselling (verb - present participle)"],"antonyms":["undersell (verb)"],"related_terms":["sales figures","market share","revenue","profit","competition","product performance"]},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Relatively frequent in business and marketing contexts.","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The word 'outsold' means that something has been more successful in terms of sales than something else. It's used to compare the sales performance of different products or companies. You'll often see it in business reports, marketing analysis, or news articles about sales figures.","priority":"★★☆"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The iPhone has consistently **outsold** its competitors in the smartphone market.","translation":"iPhoneはスマートフォン市場において、一貫して競合他社製品より多く売れている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"売り上げで上回った"},{"sentence":"Her latest novel **outsold** her previous books by a significant margin.","translation":"彼女の最新の小説は、以前の著書を大幅に上回る売り上げを記録した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"売り上げで上回った"},{"sentence":"Despite the high price, the electric car **outsold** expectations.","translation":"高価格にもかかわらず、その電気自動車は予想を上回る売り上げを記録した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"売り上げで上回った"}]}
